definitions.definition: An area of ground that tends evenly upward or downward.
examples: I had to climb a small slope to get to the site.

definitions.definition: The degree to which a surface tends upward or downward.
examples: The road has a very sharp downward slope at that point.

definitions.definition: The ratio of the vertical and horizontal distances between two points lying on the line.
examples: The slope of this line is 0.5
labels: with respect to a fixed coordinate system
definitions.label_groups: mathematics , of a line , with respect to a fixed coordinate system

definitions.definition: The slope of the line tangent to the curve at the given point.
examples: The slope of a parabola increases linearly with x .
labels: of a curve at a given point
definitions.label_groups: mathematics , of a curve at a given point ; sometimes proscribed , see Usage notes

definitions.definition: The angle a roof surface makes with the horizontal , expressed as a ratio of the units of vertical rise to the units of horizontal length (sometimes referred to as run ).
examples: The slope of an asphalt shingle roof system should be 4:12 or greater.

definitions.definition: A person of Chinese or other East Asian descent.
